all_questions.question: What was one of the main problems with the current phrase-based extraction system?
all_questions.context: So the problem is that in your normal phrase-based extraction you already have a large number of phrases.

all_questions.question: Why were there too many extractable lures in the current system?
all_questions.context: And now you are also adding many more by subtracting varying shorter ones from the bigger ones. So the number of extractable lures is too high.

all_questions.question: What was one of the limitations on the size of phrases that could be extracted?
all_questions.context: So these constants that were used to limit it were very arbitrary. So the initial phrases were extracted as normal up to 10 words in a row, but the rules that were created were always limited to have at most six symbols.

all_questions.question: Why was there a need for hypothesis recombination in the new type of search?
all_questions.context: The language model is a non-local feature, so it was more difficult to integrate it into this new type of search. But we'll talk about it only in a second.

all_questions.question: What was one of the reservations people had about the new type of search?
all_questions.context: So one reservation that people always had is that this is not a proper syntactic model, so why don't we move to proper syntax where the non-terminals have some linguistic meaning and where there is some restriction on what can be plugged
